meanings.definition: A person whose occupation is making or altering garments.
meanings.sent1: The tailor fixed the torn sleeve on my jacket.
meanings.sent2: I need to take my dress to the tailor for alterations.
meanings.sent3: The tailor joked that he could sew a dress blindfolded.
meanings.sent4: She tailored the suit to fit him perfectly, like a glove.
meanings.sent5: The tailor's shop was filled with colorful fabrics and sewing machines.

meanings.definition: To make or adapt (something) for a particular purpose or person.
meanings.sent1: I will tailor the presentation to suit the audience's interests.
meanings.sent2: She tailored the lesson plan to meet the students' needs.
meanings.sent3: He decided to tailor his workout routine to focus on cardio.
meanings.sent4: The chef tailored the recipe to accommodate dietary restrictions.
meanings.sent5: They tailored the event to cater to a diverse range of preferences.

meanings.definition: To fit or provide (something) with a specific feature or quality.
meanings.sent1: The company will tailor the product to meet customer demands.
meanings.sent2: She tailored her resume to highlight her relevant skills.
meanings.sent3: He tried to tailor his speech to appeal to a younger audience.
meanings.sent4: The designer tailored the dress with intricate lace details.
meanings.sent5: They tailored the software to be user-friendly for all ages.
